query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Taciti, soli, sanza compagnia 2 n’andavam l’un dinanzi e l’altro dopo, 3 come frati minor vanno per via.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Silent, alone, without company 2 we went, one in front and the other behind, 3 like friars minor going on their way.
**Malay:**
1 Diam, sendirian, tanpa teman 2 kami berjalan, yang satu di depan dan yang lain di belakang, 3 seperti biarawan-biarawan kecil berjalan di jalan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 E come l’un pensier de l’altro scoppia, 11 così nacque di quello un altro poi, 12 che la prima paura mi fé doppia.
query.result:
**English:**
10 And as one thought bursts from another, 11 so from that one another was born, 12 which doubled my first fear.
**Malay:**
10 Dan seperti satu pikiran meledak dari pikiran lainnya, 11 maka lahirlah dari pikiran itu pikiran lainnya, 12 yang menggandakan ketakutan pertamaku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Io pensava così: ‘Questi per noi 14 sono scherniti con danno e con beffa 15 sì fatta, ch’assai credo che lor nòi.
query.result:
**English:**
13 I thought thus: ‘These people are mocked by us 14 with harm and mockery 15 so great that I believe they are harmed enough.
**Malay:**
13 Aku berpikir demikian: ‘Orang-orang ini diejek oleh kita 14 dengan kerugian dan ejekan 15 sedemikian rupa sehingga aku yakin mereka sudah cukup menderita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Se l’ira sovra ’l mal voler s’aggueffa, 17 ei ne verranno dietro più crudeli 18 che ’l cane a quella lievre ch’elli acceffa’.
query.result:
**English:**
16 If anger seizes him over evil-wishing, 17 they will come after us more cruelly 18 than the dog after the hare that he seizes.
**Malay:**
16 Jika kemarahan menguasainya karena keinginan jahat, 17 mereka akan mengejar kita dengan lebih kejam 18 daripada anjing mengejar kelinci yang diterkamnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Già mi sentia tutti arricciar li peli 20 de la paura e stava in dietro intento, 21 quand’ io dissi: «Maestro, se non celi
22 te e me tostamente, i’ ho pavento 23 d’i Malebranche. Noi li avem già dietro; 24 io li ’magino sì, che già li sento».
query.result:
**English:**
19 Already I felt all my hair stand on end 20 from fear and was intent on turning back, 21 when I said: "Master, if you do not hide
22 yourself and me quickly, I fear 23 the Malebranche. We have them already behind us; 24 I imagine them so that I already hear them".
**Malay:**
19 Sudah terasa semua rambutku berdiri 20 karena takut dan berusaha untuk mundur, 21 ketika aku berkata: "Guru, jika engkau tidak menyembunyikan
22 dirimu dan aku dengan cepat, aku takut 23 pada Malebranche. Kita sudah mendengar mereka di belakang kita; 24 aku membayangkan mereka sehingga aku sudah mendengar mereka".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 E quei: «S’i’ fossi di piombato vetro, 26 l’imagine di fuor tua non trarrei 27 più tosto a me, che quella dentro ’mpetro.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And he: "If I were made of molten glass, 26 I would not draw your outward image 27 to myself more quickly than that within me.
**Malay:**
25 Dan dia: "Jika aku terbuat dari kaca cair, 26 aku tidak akan menarik bayanganmu dari luar 27 lebih cepat kepadaku, daripada bayangan di dalam diriku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Pur mo venieno i tuo’ pensier tra ’ miei, 29 con simile atto e con simile faccia, 30 sì che d’intrambi un sol consiglio fei.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Even though your thoughts came among mine, 29 with a similar gesture and a similar face, 30 so that from both of us I made a single decision.
**Malay:**
28 Meskipun pikiranmu datang di antara pikiranku, 29 dengan sikap yang sama dan wajah yang sama, 30 sehingga dari keduanya aku membuat satu keputusan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 S’elli è che sì la destra costa giaccia, 32 che noi possiam ne l’altra bolgia scendere, 33 noi fuggirem l’imaginata caccia».
query.result:
**English:**
31 If it is that the right bank is so steep, 32 that we can descend into the other pouch, 33 we will escape the imagined hunt.
**Malay:**
31 Jika tebing sebelah kanan memang curam, 32 sehingga kita dapat turun ke jurang yang lain, 33 kita akan melarikan diri dari perburuan yang dibayangkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Già non compié di tal consiglio rendere, 35 ch’io li vidi venir con l’ali tese 36 non molto lungi, per volerne prendere.
query.result:
**English:**
34 I had not yet finished giving them this advice, 35 when I saw them coming with their wings spread 36 not far away, wanting to seize him.
**Malay:**
34 Aku belum selesai memberikan nasihat itu kepada mereka, 35 ketika aku melihat mereka datang dengan sayap yang terbentang 36 tidak jauh, ingin menangkapnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Lo duca mio di sùbito mi prese, 38 come la madre ch’al romore è desta 39 e vede presso a sé le fiamme accese,
40 che prende il figlio e fugge e non s’arresta, 41 avendo più di lui che di sé cura, 42 tanto che solo una camiscia vesta;
43 e giù dal collo de la ripa dura 44 supin si diede a la pendente roccia, 45 che l’un de’ lati a l’altra bolgia tura.
query.result:
**English:**
37 My leader suddenly seized me, 38 like a mother who is awakened by a noise 39 and sees the flames burning near her,
40 who seizes her son and flees and does not stop, 41 caring more for him than for herself, 42 so much so that she wears only a chemise;
43 and down from the neck of the hard bank 44 he gave himself supine to the sloping rock, 45 which blocks one of the sides of the next pouch.
**Malay:**
37 Pemimpinku tiba-tiba menangkapku, 38 seperti seorang ibu yang terbangun oleh suara gaduh 39 dan melihat api menyala di dekatnya,
40 yang meraih anaknya dan melarikan diri tanpa henti, 41 lebih peduli padanya daripada dirinya sendiri, 42 sehingga dia hanya mengenakan sehelai kemeja;
43 dan turun dari leher tebing yang keras 44 dia membaringkan dirinya di atas batu yang miring, 45 yang menghalangi salah satu sisi kantong berikutnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Non corse mai sì tosto acqua per doccia 47 a volger ruota di molin terragno, 48 quand’ ella più verso le pale approccia,
49 come ’l maestro mio per quel vivagno, 50 portandosene me sovra ’l suo petto, 51 come suo figlio, non come compagno.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Water never ran so swiftly through a millrace 47 to turn the wheel of a mill on the ground, 48 when it approaches the paddles the most,
49 as my master did along that narrow path, 50 carrying me on his chest, 51 like his son, not like a companion.
**Malay:**
46 Air tidak pernah mengalir secepat itu melalui saluran air 47 untuk memutar roda kincir air di tanah, 48 ketika air itu paling mendekati bilah-bilahnya,
49 seperti tuanku di sepanjang jalan sempit itu, 50 membawaku di dadanya, 51 seperti putranya, bukan seperti temannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 A pena fuoro i piè suoi giunti al letto 53 del fondo giù, ch’e’ furon in sul colle 54 sovresso noi; ma non lì era sospetto:
55 ché l’alta provedenza che lor volle 56 porre ministri de la fossa quinta, 57 poder di partirs’ indi a tutti tolle.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Scarcely had his feet reached the bed 53 at the bottom, than they were on the hill 54 above us; but there was no cause for alarm:
55 for the high providence that willed them 56 to be ministers of the fifth pit, 57 takes away from all the power to depart from there.
**Malay:**
52 Baru saja kakinya sampai di dasar 53 dari bawah, ketika mereka berada di atas bukit 54 di atas kita; tetapi tidak ada yang perlu dikhawatirkan:
55 karena pemeliharaan ilahi yang menghendaki mereka 56 menjadi pelayan lubang kelima, 57 merampas kekuasaan untuk pergi dari sana dari semua orang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Là giù trovammo una gente dipinta 59 che giva intorno assai con lenti passi, 60 piangendo e nel sembiante stanca e vinta.
query.result:
**English:**
58 Down there we found a painted people 59 who went around very slowly, 60 weeping and in their appearance tired and defeated.
**Malay:**
58 Di sana kami menemukan orang-orang yang dicat 59 yang berjalan berkeliling dengan sangat lambat, 60 menangis dan dalam penampilan mereka lelah dan kalah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Elli avean cappe con cappucci bassi 62 dinanzi a li occhi, fatte de la taglia 63 che in Clugnì per li monaci fassi.
query.result:
**English:**
61 They had cowls with low hoods 62 in front of their eyes, made of the same coarse cloth 63 that is made in Cluny for the monks.
**Malay:**
61 Mereka memakai jubah berkerudung rendah 62 di depan mata mereka, terbuat dari kain kasar yang sama 63 yang dibuat di Cluny untuk para biarawan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Di fuor dorate son, sì ch’elli abbaglia; 65 ma dentro tutte piombo, e gravi tanto, 66 che Federigo le mettea di paglia.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Outside they are gilded, so that they dazzle; 65 but inside they are all lead, and so heavy, 66 that Frederick would have put straw in them instead.
**Malay:**
64 Di luarnya berlapis emas, sehingga mereka menyilaukan; 65 tetapi di dalamnya semuanya timah, dan sangat berat, 66 sehingga Frederick akan menggantinya dengan jerami.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Per ch’io al duca mio: «Fa che tu trovi 74 alcun ch’al fatto o al nome si conosca, 75 e li occhi, sì andando, intorno movi».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Wherefore I said to my guide: "Do you find 74 someone who may be known by deed or name, 75 and as we go, keep your eyes moving around."
**Malay:**
73 Oleh karena itu aku berkata kepada pemanduku: "Carilah 74 seseorang yang dapat dikenali dari perbuatan atau namanya, 75 dan sambil berjalan, gerakkan matamu ke sekeliling."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 E un che ’ntese la parola tosca, 77 di retro a noi gridò: «Tenete i piedi, 78 voi che correte sì per l’aura fosca!
79 Forse ch’avrai da me quel che tu chiedi».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And one who understood the Tuscan word, 77 cried out behind us: "Hold your feet, 78 you who run so through the murky air!
79 Perhaps you will have from me what you ask for."
**Malay:**
76 Dan seorang yang mengerti perkataan Toskana, 77 berteriak di belakang kami: "Tahan langkah kalian, 78 kalian yang berlari begitu cepat di udara yang gelap!
79 Mungkin kalian akan mendapatkan dariku apa yang kalian minta."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
80 Onde ’l duca si volse e disse: «Aspetta, 81 e poi secondo il suo passo procedi».
82 Ristetti, e vidi due mostrar gran fretta 83 de l’animo, col viso, d’esser meco; 84 ma tardavali ’l carco e la via stretta.
query.result:
**English:**
80 Where the leader turned and said: “Wait, 81 and then proceed at his pace.”
82 I stopped, and I saw two showing great haste 83 of spirit, with their faces, to be with me; 84 but the burden and the narrow road delayed them.
**Malay:**
80 Di situ pemimpin itu berpaling dan berkata: “Tunggu, 81 dan kemudian lanjutkan perjalanan sesuai langkahnya.”
82 Aku berhenti, dan aku melihat dua orang menunjukkan ketergesaan yang besar 83 dalam semangat, dengan wajah mereka, untuk bersamaku; 84 tetapi beban dan jalan yang sempit memperlambat mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Quando fuor giunti, assai con l’occhio bieco 86 mi rimiraron sanza far parola; 87 poi si volsero in sé, e dicean seco:
88 «Costui par vivo a l’atto de la gola; 89 e s’e’ son morti, per qual privilegio 90 vanno scoperti de la grave stola?».
query.result:
**English:**
85 When they were outside, they looked at me askance 86 without saying a word; 87 then they turned to each other and said among themselves:
88 "This one seems alive from the way he walks; 89 and if they are dead, by what privilege 90 do they go uncovered by the heavy shroud?"
**Malay:**
85 Ketika mereka berada di luar, mereka menatapku dengan pandangan sinis 86 tanpa mengucapkan sepatah kata pun; 87 kemudian mereka berpaling kepada diri mereka sendiri, dan berkata di antara mereka:
88 "Orang ini tampak hidup dari cara dia berjalan; 89 dan jika mereka sudah mati, dengan hak istimewa apa 90 mereka tidak ditutupi oleh kain kafan yang berat?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Poi disser me: «O Tosco, ch’al collegio 92 de l’ipocriti tristi se’ venuto, 93 dir chi tu se’ non avere in dispregio».
query.result:
**English:**
91 Then they said to me: "O Tuscan, who have come to the college 92 of the sad hypocrites, 93 do not disdain to tell who you are."
**Malay:**
91 Kemudian mereka berkata kepadaku: "Hai orang Toskana, yang telah datang ke perguruan tinggi 92 para munafik yang menyedihkan, 93 jangan meremehkan untuk mengatakan siapa dirimu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 E io a loro: «I’ fui nato e cresciuto 95 sovra ’l bel fiume d’Arno a la gran villa, 96 e son col corpo ch’i’ ho sempre avuto.
query.result:
**English:**
94 And I to them: "I was born and raised 95 above the fair river of Arno in the great city, 96 and I am with the body that I have always had.
**Malay:**
94 Dan aku kepada mereka: "Aku dilahirkan dan dibesarkan 95 di atas sungai Arno yang indah di kota besar, 96 dan aku bersama tubuh yang selalu kumiliki.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Ma voi chi siete, a cui tanto distilla 98 quant’ i’ veggio dolor giù per le guance? 99 e che pena è in voi che sì sfavilla?».
query.result:
**English:**
97 But you, who are you, from whose eyes such pain 98 streams down your cheeks as I see? 99 And what sorrow is in you that so shines forth?
**Malay:**
97 Tetapi kamu, siapakah kamu, yang dari matamu kesedihan yang begitu 98 mengalir di pipimu seperti yang kulihat? 99 Dan apakah penderitaan dalam dirimu yang begitu bersinar?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 E l’un rispuose a me: «Le cappe rance 101 son di piombo sì grosse, che li pesi 102 fan così cigolar le lor bilance.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And one of them answered me: "The leaden cloaks 101 are so heavy that their weights 102 make their scales creak."
**Malay:**
100 Dan salah seorang dari mereka menjawabku: "Jubah-jubah timah 101 sangat berat, sehingga bebannya 102 membuat timbangan mereka berderit."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Frati godenti fummo, e bolognesi; 104 io Catalano e questi Loderingo 105 nomati, e da tua terra insieme presi
106 come suole esser tolto un uom solingo, 107 per conservar sua pace; e fummo tali, 108 ch’ancor si pare intorno dal Gardingo».
query.result:
**English:**
103 We were Jovial Friars, and Bolognese; 104 I Catalano, and he Loderingo 105 named, and together taken from thy land,
106 as it is wont to take a single man 107 to save his peace; and such were we, 108 that still it seems that all about Gardingo».
**Malay:**
103 Kami adalah Friar Jovial, dan Bolognese; 104 aku Catalano, dan dia bernama Loderingo 105 dan bersama-sama diambil dari tanahmu,
106 sebagaimana biasanya mengambil seorang pria lajang 107 untuk menjaga kedamaiannya; dan kami seperti itu, 108 yang masih tampak di sekitar Gardingo».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Io cominciai: «O frati, i vostri mali . . . »; 110 ma più non dissi, ch’a l’occhio mi corse 111 un, crucifisso in terra con tre pali.
query.result:
**English:**
109 I began: "O brothers, your evils . . . "; 110 but I said no more, for my eye caught sight of 111 one crucified on the ground with three stakes.
**Malay:**
109 Aku mulai: "Hai saudara-saudaraku, kejahatan-kejahatanmu . . . "; 110 tetapi aku tidak mengatakan apa-apa lagi, karena mataku menangkap pandangan 111 seseorang yang disalibkan di tanah dengan tiga tiang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Quando mi vide, tutto si distorse, 113 soffiando ne la barba con sospiri; 114 e ’l frate Catalan, ch’a ciò s’accorse,
115 mi disse: «Quel confitto che tu miri, 116 consigliò i Farisei che convenia 117 porre un uom per lo popolo a’ martìri.
query.result:
**English:**
112 When he saw me, he twisted all over, 113 blowing in his beard with sighs; 114 and Friar Catalan, who noticed this,
115 said to me: “That conflicted one you see there, 116 advised the Pharisees that it was fitting 117 to put a man to death for the people.
**Malay:**
112 Ketika dia melihatku, dia memutarbalikkan seluruh tubuhnya, 113 meniup janggutnya dengan desahan; 114 dan Friar Catalan, yang menyadari hal itu,
115 berkata kepadaku: “Orang yang berkonflik yang kaulihat di sana, 116 menasihati orang-orang Farisi bahwa sudah sepantasnya 117 untuk membunuh seseorang demi rakyat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Attraversato è, nudo, ne la via, 119 come tu vedi, ed è mestier ch’el senta 120 qualunque passa, come pesa, pria.
query.result:
**English:**
118 He has crossed it, naked, on the road, 119 as you see, and it is necessary that he feel 120 whoever passes, how heavy he is, first.
**Malay:**
118 Dia telah menyeberanginya, telanjang, di jalan, 119 seperti yang kaulihat, dan perlu baginya untuk merasakan 120 siapa pun yang lewat, betapa beratnya dia, terlebih dahulu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 E a tal modo il socero si stenta 122 in questa fossa, e li altri dal concilio 123 che fu per li Giudei mala sementa».
query.result:
**English:**
121 And in such manner the father-in-law is tormented 122 in this ditch, and the others of the council 123 that was an evil seed for the Jews.
**Malay:**
121 Dan dengan cara demikian si bapa mertua menderita 122 di dalam parit ini, dan yang lainnya dari dewan 123 yang merupakan benih yang jahat bagi orang-orang Yahudi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Allor vid’ io maravigliar Virgilio 125 sovra colui ch’era disteso in croce 126 tanto vilmente ne l’etterno essilio.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Then I saw Virgil marvel 125 over the one who was stretched out on the cross, 126 so vilely in eternal exile.
**Malay:**
124 Kemudian kulihat Virgil takjub 125 terhadap dia yang terentang di kayu salib, 126 dengan hina di pengasingan abadi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Poscia drizzò al frate cotal voce: 128 «Non vi dispiaccia, se vi lece, dirci 129 s’a la man destra giace alcuna foce
130 onde noi amendue possiamo uscirci, 131 sanza costrigner de li angeli neri 132 che vegnan d’esto fondo a dipartirci».
query.result:
**English:**
127 Then he turned to the friar and said in a gentle voice: 128 "Do not be displeased if it pleases you to tell us 129 if there is any outlet to the right,
130 so that we both can get out of here, 131 without having to force the black angels 132 to come up from this depth to separate us."
**Malay:**
127 Kemudian dia berpaling kepada biarawan itu dan berkata dengan suara lembut: 128 "Janganlah tidak senang, jika Anda berkenan, untuk memberi tahu kami 129 jika ada jalan keluar di sebelah kanan,
130 sehingga kami berdua dapat keluar dari sini, 131 tanpa harus memaksa para malaikat hitam 132 untuk datang dari kedalaman ini untuk memisahkan kami."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Rispuose adunque: «Più che tu non speri 134 s’appressa un sasso che da la gran cerchia 135 si move e varca tutt’ i vallon feri,
136 salvo che ’n questo è rotto e nol coperchia; 137 montar potrete su per la ruina, 138 che giace in costa e nel fondo soperchia».
query.result:
**English:**
133 He replied: "More quickly than you hope 134 a rock is approaching, which from the great circle 135 moves and crosses all the wild valleys,
136 except that in this one it is broken and does not cover it; 137 you will be able to climb up the ruin, 138 which lies on the slope and is excessive at the bottom."
**Malay:**
133 Maka jawabnya: "Lebih cepat dari yang kauharapkan 134 sebuah batu sedang mendekat, yang dari lingkaran besar 135 bergerak dan melintasi semua lembah liar,
136 kecuali bahwa di lembah ini batu itu pecah dan tidak menutupinya; 137 kalian akan dapat memanjat reruntuhan itu, 138 yang terletak di lereng dan sangat banyak di dasarnya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Lo duca stette un poco a testa china; 140 poi disse: «Mal contava la bisogna 141 colui che i peccator di qua uncina».
query.result:
**English:**
139 The leader stood for a while with his head bowed; 140 then he said: "He who ensnares the sinners here 141 told the story badly."
**Malay:**
139 Pemimpin itu berdiri sejenak dengan kepala tertunduk; 140 kemudian berkata: "Orang yang menjerat para pendosa di sini 141 telah menceritakan kisah itu dengan buruk."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 E ’l frate: «Io udi’ già dire a Bologna 143 del diavol vizi assai, tra ’ quali udi’ 144 ch’elli è bugiardo, e padre di menzogna».
query.result:
**English:**
142 And the friar: "I heard it said once in Bologna 143 about the devil's many vices, among which I heard 144 that he is a liar, and the father of lies."
**Malay:**
142 Dan saudara itu: "Aku pernah mendengar dikatakan di Bologna 143 tentang banyak kejahatan iblis, di antaranya aku mendengar 144 bahwa dia adalah pembohong, dan bapak segala dusta."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
145 Appresso il duca a gran passi sen gì, 146 turbato un poco d’ira nel sembiante; 147 ond’ io da li ’ncarcati mi parti’
148 dietro a le poste de le care piante.
query.result:
**English:**
145 Behind the leader I went with great strides, 146 his face a little troubled with anger; 147 so from there I departed burdened
148 behind the tracks of his dear feet.
**Malay:**
145 Di belakang pemimpin itu aku melangkah dengan langkah-langkah besar, 146 wajahnya sedikit bermasalah dengan kemarahan; 147 jadi dari sana aku berangkat dengan beban
148 di belakang jejak-jejak kakinya yang terkasih.
